text.text_translated:
From 100,000 to 50,000 years ago, we saw signs of early human civilisation. Civilisation is when people live in groups with rules. For example, people made pictures in rocks. We do not know the link between these signs and language.

People's brains did not get bigger quickly. But people became more clever. They also changed a lot. Did language make their brains grow? Or did their clever brains start to make language?
